title: Station 01: Cafeteria
description: Like the mass meetings of the civil rights era, we begin with community orientation. Opening + Remarks.
volunteer_script: Welcome to the Gathering. This is where we orient ourselves before the work begins. Please feel free to listen to the remarks and find your group.
qr_instruction: Scan to view the detailed schedule and opening remarks.

title: Station 02: Alumni Hall
description: We exit the comfort of the gathering and walk to the Auditorium. This is the space of confrontation and history.
volunteer_script: This is The Threshold. It is a space of history and confrontation. We invite you to enter quietly and observe.
qr_instruction: Scan to read about the historical significance of Alumni Hall.

title: Station 03: Harris Hall
description: A necessary pause. Community Art & Processing. Here you are invited to create and add your mark.
volunteer_script: Welcome to the Processing space. You are invited to reflect and add your mark to the community wall.
qr_instruction: Scan to share a digital reflection or view the community art gallery.

title: Station 04: Lathem Hall
description: The core interactive zone. Digital Collection: Preparation / Beloved Community.
volunteer_script: This is the Reflection zone. Here you will find the 5 Stations of Preparation. You may visit them in any order.
qr_instruction: Scan to access the Digital Collection and audio guides.

title: Belief
description: Name the conviction that holds you steady.

title: Courage
description: Call out the moment you choose bravery.

title: Identity
description: Who are you when nobody is watching?

title: Preparation
description: Freedom is built. What are you training for?
